segment.source: MD Conversion - Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Compliance policies define the rules and settings that a device must comply with in order to be considered compliant by conditional access polices.
segment.target: Compliance policies define the rules and settings that a device must comply with in order to be considered compliant by conditional access polices.

segment.source: You can also use compliance policies to monitor and remediate compliant issues with devices independently of conditional access.
segment.target: You can also use compliance policies to monitor and remediate compliant issues with devices independently of conditional access.

segment.source: Whether the device is jailbroken or rooted, or if the device is reported as unhealthy by the Windows device health attestation service.
segment.target: Whether the device is jailbroken or rooted, or if the device is reported as unhealthy by the Windows device health attestation service.

segment.source: Whether email on the device is managed by an policy
segment.target: Whether email on the device is managed by an policy

segment.source: Minimum OS version required - Typically this depends on your company compliance policies and security requirements.
segment.target: Minimum OS version required - Typically this depends on your company compliance policies and security requirements.

segment.source: This helps to prevent access to devices that might have security vulnerabilities because they are using an older OS version.
segment.target: This helps to prevent access to devices that might have security vulnerabilities because they are using an older OS version.

segment.source: Maximum OS version allowed - You may choose not to support the latest OS version available before testing or other reasons.
segment.target: Maximum OS version allowed - You may choose not to support the latest OS version available before testing or other reasons.

segment.source: You can choose to block devices that have a version later than the one you have specified.
segment.target: You can choose to block devices that have a version later than the one you have specified.

segment.source: The device will not be able to access company resources until the policy is changed.
segment.target: The device will not be able to access company resources until the policy is changed.

segment.source: On Windows PCs, Windows Operating System version 8.1, is reported as 6.3 instead of 8.1.
segment.target: On Windows PCs, Windows Operating System version 8.1, is reported as 6.3 instead of 8.1.

segment.source: If the OS version rule is set to Windows 8.1 for Windows, then the device will be reported as non-compliant even if the device has Windows OS 8.1.
segment.target: If the OS version rule is set to Windows 8.1 for Windows, then the device will be reported as non-compliant even if the device has Windows OS 8.1.

segment.source: Make sure you are setting the right reported version of Windows for the Minimum and Maximum OS rules.
segment.target: Make sure you are setting the right reported version of Windows for the Minimum and Maximum OS rules.

segment.source: The version number must match the version returned by the winver command.
segment.target: The version number must match the version returned by the winver command.

segment.source: Windows Phones do not have this issue, the version is reported as 8.1 as expected.
segment.target: Windows Phones do not have this issue, the version is reported as 8.1 as expected.

segment.source: You deploy compliance policies to users and devices.
segment.target: You deploy compliance policies to users and devices.

segment.source: When a compliance policy is deployed to a user, then all of the users devices are checked for compliance.
segment.target: When a compliance policy is deployed to a user, then all of the users devices are checked for compliance.

segment.source: The following table lists the device types supported by compliance policies and how noncompliant settings are managed when the policy is used with a conditional access policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the device types supported by compliance policies and how noncompliant settings are managed when the policy is used with a conditional access policy.

segment.source: Remediated = Compliance is enforced by the device operating system (for example, the user is forced to set a PIN).
segment.target: Remediated = Compliance is enforced by the device operating system (for example, the user is forced to set a PIN).

segment.source: There is never a case when the setting will be noncompliant.
segment.target: There is never a case when the setting will be noncompliant.

segment.source: Quarantined = The device operating system does not enforce compliance (for example, Android devices do not force the user to encrypt the device).
segment.target: Quarantined = The device operating system does not enforce compliance (for example, Android devices do not force the user to encrypt the device).

segment.source: The device will be blocked if the user is targeted by a conditional access policy.
segment.target: The device will be blocked if the user is targeted by a conditional access policy.

segment.source: The company portal or web portal will notify the user about any compliance issues.
segment.target: The company portal or web portal will notify the user about any compliance issues.

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Compliance Policies > Add.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Compliance Policies > Add.

segment.source: On the Create Policy page, configure the settings you require:
segment.target: On the Create Policy page, configure the settings you require:

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the compliance policy.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the compliance policy.

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the compliance policy.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the compliance policy.

segment.source: Require a password to unlock mobile devices
segment.target: Require a password to unlock mobile devices

segment.source: Require users to enter a password before they can access their device.
segment.target: Require users to enter a password before they can access their device.

segment.source: Let users create simple passwords such as ‘1234’ or ‘1111’.
segment.target: Let users create simple passwords such as ‘1234’ or ‘1111’.

segment.source: Specifies the minimum number of digits or characters that the user’s password must contain.
segment.target: Specifies the minimum number of digits or characters that the user’s password must contain.

segment.source: For devices that run Windows and are secured with a Microsoft Account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if Minimum password length is greater than 8 characters.
segment.target: For devices that run Windows and are secured with a Microsoft Account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if Minimum password length is greater than 8 characters.

segment.source: Specifies whether users must create an Alphanumeric, or a Numeric password.
segment.target: Specifies whether users must create an Alphanumeric, or a Numeric password.

segment.source: If Required password type is set to Alphanumeric, this setting specifies the minimum number of character sets that the password must contain.
segment.target: If Required password type is set to Alphanumeric, this setting specifies the minimum number of character sets that the password must contain.

segment.source: The four character sets are lowercase letters, uppercase letters, symbols, and numbers.
segment.target: The four character sets are lowercase letters, uppercase letters, symbols, and numbers.

segment.source: Setting a higher number for this setting will require users to create more complex passwords.
segment.target: Setting a higher number for this setting will require users to create more complex passwords.

segment.source: For devices that run Windows and are secured with a Microsoft Account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if Minimum number of character sets is more than 2.
segment.target: For devices that run Windows and are secured with a Microsoft Account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if Minimum number of character sets is more than 2.

segment.source: For iOS devices, this setting refers to the number of special characters (for example, !, #, &) that must be included in the password.
segment.target: For iOS devices, this setting refers to the number of special characters (for example, !, #, &) that must be included in the password.

segment.source: Configures password requirements for Android devices.
segment.target: Configures password requirements for Android devices.

segment.source: Minutes of inactivity before password is required
segment.target: Minutes of inactivity before password is required

segment.source: Specifies the idle time before the user must re-enter their password.
segment.target: Specifies the idle time before the user must re-enter their password.

segment.source: Select the number of days before the user’s password expires and they must create a new one.
segment.target: Select the number of days before the user’s password expires and they must create a new one.

segment.source: Use this setting in conjunction with Prevent reuse of previous passwords to restrict the user from creating previously used passwords.
segment.target: Use this setting in conjunction with Prevent reuse of previous passwords to restrict the user from creating previously used passwords.

segment.source: If Remember password history is selected, specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be re-used.
segment.target: If Remember password history is selected, specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be re-used.

segment.source: Require a password when the device returns from an idle state
segment.target: Require a password when the device returns from an idle state

segment.source: This setting should be used together with the in the Minutes of inactivity before password is required setting.
segment.target: This setting should be used together with the in the Minutes of inactivity before password is required setting.

segment.source: The end-users will be prompted to enter a password to access a device that has been inactive for the time specified in the Minutes of inactivity before password is required setting.
segment.target: The end-users will be prompted to enter a password to access a device that has been inactive for the time specified in the Minutes of inactivity before password is required setting.

segment.source: Requires the device to be encrypted in order to connect to resources.
segment.target: Requires the device to be encrypted in order to connect to resources.

segment.source: Devices that run Windows Phone 8 are automatically encrypted.
segment.target: Devices that run Windows Phone 8 are automatically encrypted.

segment.source: Devices that run iOS are encrypted when you configure the setting Require a password to unlock mobile devices.
segment.target: Devices that run iOS are encrypted when you configure the setting Require a password to unlock mobile devices.

segment.source: Require devices to be reported as healthy
segment.target: Require devices to be reported as healthy

segment.source: You can set a rule to require that Windows 10 devices must be reported as healthy in new or existing Compliance Policies.
segment.target: You can set a rule to require that Windows 10 devices must be reported as healthy in new or existing Compliance Policies.

segment.source: If this setting is enabled, Windows 10 devices will be evaluated via the Health Attestation Service (HAS) for the following data points:
segment.target: If this setting is enabled, Windows 10 devices will be evaluated via the Health Attestation Service (HAS) for the following data points:

segment.source: When Bitlocker is on, the device is able to protect data that is stored on the drive from unauthorized access, when the system is turned off or goes to hibernation.
segment.target: When Bitlocker is on, the device is able to protect data that is stored on the drive from unauthorized access, when the system is turned off or goes to hibernation.

segment.source: Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption encrypts all data stored on the Windows operating system volume.
segment.target: Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption encrypts all data stored on the Windows operating system volume.

segment.source: BitLocker uses the TPM to help protect the Windows operating system and user data and helps to ensure that a computer is not tampered with, even if it is left unattended, lost, or stolen.
segment.target: BitLocker uses the TPM to help protect the Windows operating system and user data and helps to ensure that a computer is not tampered with, even if it is left unattended, lost, or stolen.

segment.source: If the computer is equipped with a compatible TPM, BitLocker uses the TPM to lock the encryption keys that protect the data.
segment.target: If the computer is equipped with a compatible TPM, BitLocker uses the TPM to lock the encryption keys that protect the data.

segment.source: As a result, the keys cannot be accessed until the TPM has verified the state of the computer.
segment.target: As a result, the keys cannot be accessed until the TPM has verified the state of the computer.

segment.source: Code integrity is a feature that validates the integrity of a driver or system file each time it is loaded into memory.
segment.target: Code integrity is a feature that validates the integrity of a driver or system file each time it is loaded into memory.

segment.source: Code integrity detects whether an unsigned driver or system file is being loaded into the kernel, or whether a system file has been modified by malicious software that is being run by a user account with administrator privileges.
segment.target: Code integrity detects whether an unsigned driver or system file is being loaded into the kernel, or whether a system file has been modified by malicious software that is being run by a user account with administrator privileges.

segment.source: When Secure Boot is enabled, the system is forced to boot to a factory trusted state.
segment.target: When Secure Boot is enabled, the system is forced to boot to a factory trusted state.

segment.source: Also, when Secure Boot is enabled, the core components used to boot the machine must have correct cryptographic signatures that are trusted by the organization that manufactured the device.
segment.target: Also, when Secure Boot is enabled, the core components used to boot the machine must have correct cryptographic signatures that are trusted by the organization that manufactured the device.

segment.source: The UEFI firmware verifies this before it lets the machine start.
segment.target: The UEFI firmware verifies this before it lets the machine start.

segment.source: If any files have been tampered with, breaking their signature, the system will not boot.
segment.target: If any files have been tampered with, breaking their signature, the system will not boot.

segment.source: Early-launch antimalware is enabled (this setting only applies to PCs.)
segment.target: Early-launch antimalware is enabled (this setting only applies to PCs.)

segment.source: Early launch anti-malware (ELAM) provides protection for the computers in your network when they start up and before third-party drivers initialize.
segment.target: Early launch anti-malware (ELAM) provides protection for the computers in your network when they start up and before third-party drivers initialize.

segment.source: This rule is turned off by default.
segment.target: This rule is turned off by default.

segment.source: For information on how the HAS service works, see Health Attestation CSP.
segment.target: For information on how the HAS service works, see Health Attestation CSP.

segment.source: Device must not be jailbroken or rooted
segment.target: Device must not be jailbroken or rooted

segment.source: If enabled, jailbroken (iOS), or rooted (Android) devices will not be compliant.
segment.target: If enabled, jailbroken (iOS), or rooted (Android) devices will not be compliant.

segment.source: Email account must be managed by Intune
segment.target: Email account must be managed by Intune

segment.source: When this option is selected, the device will be reported as noncompliant if the user has set up an email account on the device that matches an Intune email profile that was deployed to the device by an IT admin.
segment.target: When this option is selected, the device will be reported as noncompliant if the user has set up an email account on the device that matches an Intune email profile that was deployed to the device by an IT admin.

segment.source: Intune cannot overwrite the user-provisioned profile, and therefore cannot manage it.
segment.target: Intune cannot overwrite the user-provisioned profile, and therefore cannot manage it.

segment.source: To ensure compliance, the user must remove the existing email settings, then, Intune can install the managed email profile.
segment.target: To ensure compliance, the user must remove the existing email settings, then, Intune can install the managed email profile.

segment.source: For details about email profiles, see Configure access to corporate email using email profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details about email profiles, see Configure access to corporate email using email profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Select the email profile that must be managed by Intune
segment.target: Select the email profile that must be managed by Intune

segment.source: If Email account must be managed by Intune is selected, click Select to choose the Intune email profile that devices must be managed by.
segment.target: If Email account must be managed by Intune is selected, click Select to choose the Intune email profile that devices must be managed by.

segment.source: The email profile must be present on the device.
segment.target: The email profile must be present on the device.

segment.source: Select Yes to require automatic updates.
segment.target: Select Yes to require automatic updates.

segment.source: Require automatic updates – Minimum classification of updates to install automatically
segment.target: Require automatic updates – Minimum classification of updates to install automatically

segment.source: Choose the classification of updates that will be installed automatically:
segment.target: Choose the classification of updates that will be installed automatically:

segment.source: Important – Installs all updates classified as important.
segment.target: Important – Installs all updates classified as important.

segment.source: Recommended – Installs all updates classified as important or recommended
segment.target: Recommended – Installs all updates classified as important or recommended

segment.source: Minimum OS required (one for each platform)
segment.target: Minimum OS required (one for each platform)

segment.source: When a device does not meet the minimum OS version requirement, it will be reported as non-compliant.
segment.target: When a device does not meet the minimum OS version requirement, it will be reported as non-compliant.

segment.source: A link with information on how to upgrade will be displayed.
segment.target: A link with information on how to upgrade will be displayed.

segment.source: The end-user can choose to upgrade their device after which they will be able to access company resources.
segment.target: The end-user can choose to upgrade their device after which they will be able to access company resources.

segment.source: Maximum OS version allowed (one for each platform)
segment.target: Maximum OS version allowed (one for each platform)

segment.source: When a device is using an OS version later than the one specified in the rule, access to company resources is blocked and the user is asked to contact their IT admin.
segment.target: When a device is using an OS version later than the one specified in the rule, access to company resources is blocked and the user is asked to contact their IT admin.

segment.source: Until there is a change in rule to allow the OS version, this device cannot be used to access company resources.
segment.target: Until there is a change in rule to allow the OS version, this device cannot be used to access company resources.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Compliance Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Compliance Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Deploy the compliance policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the compliance policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Use the status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace to identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: Use the status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace to identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: To view devices that do not conform to a compliance policy
segment.target: To view devices that do not conform to a compliance policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Groups.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Groups.

segment.source: Open the Policy tab for any device that is compatible with compliance policies.
segment.target: Open the Policy tab for any device that is compatible with compliance policies.

segment.source: From the Filters drop-down list, select Does not conform to compliance policy.
segment.target: From the Filters drop-down list, select Does not conform to compliance policy.

segment.source: To view the Health Attestation Reports
segment.target: To view the Health Attestation Reports

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Reports.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Reports.

segment.source: In the Health Attestation Report - Create a new report page, you can view a report with all the Windows 10 health attestation data collected by Intune.
segment.target: In the Health Attestation Report - Create a new report page, you can view a report with all the Windows 10 health attestation data collected by Intune.

segment.source: You can also create a report with a subset of the data using filters.
segment.target: You can also create a report with a subset of the data using filters.

segment.source: The filters can be based on the type of device, operating system, or only a subset of data points.
segment.target: The filters can be based on the type of device, operating system, or only a subset of data points.

segment.source: How Intune policy conflicts are resolved
segment.target: How Intune policy conflicts are resolved

segment.source: When conflicts occur due to multiple Intune settings being applied to a device, the following rules apply:
segment.target: When conflicts occur due to multiple Intune settings being applied to a device, the following rules apply:

segment.source: If the conflicting settings are from an Intune configuration policy and a compliance policy, the settings in the compliance policy take precedence over the settings in the configuration policy, even if the settings in the configuration policy are more secure.
segment.target: If the conflicting settings are from an Intune configuration policy and a compliance policy, the settings in the compliance policy take precedence over the settings in the configuration policy, even if the settings in the configuration policy are more secure.

segment.source: If you have deployed multiple compliance policies, the most secure of these policies will be used.
segment.target: If you have deployed multiple compliance policies, the most secure of these policies will be used.

segment.source: You can now use the compliance policy with conditional access policies to control access to services in your organization.
segment.target: You can now use the compliance policy with conditional access policies to control access to services in your organization.

segment.source: Manage access to email and SharePoint with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Manage access to email and SharePoint with Microsoft Intune
